title: Artisan Preserving - Over 1cipes (gnv64)
description:
Artisan Preserving: Over 100 recipes for jams, chutneys and relishes, pickles, sauces and cordials, and cured meats and fish
by Emma Macdonald
Nourish | September 2014 | ISBN-10: 1848991959 | ePUB | 261 pages | 47.5 mb

Artisan Preserving is a one-stop resource for all of your preserving needs. Everyone can now enjoy the fruits of their labors with this book from the UKÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s foremost producer of a huge range of preserves. Whether you have foraged hedgerows, picked produce from your ownÃ¢â‚¬â€or a community gardenÃ¢â‚¬â€or searched out the best seasonal buys in the supermarket, this book contains a comprehensive collection of recipes for preserving fruit and vegetables, meat and fish. Learn the lost arts of curing, drying, pickling, bottling/canning, crystalizing and jellying; make all kinds of jams, jellies, pickles, chutneys, relishes, cordials, fruit liqueurs, sauces, ketchups, confits and salamis, fruit curds, cheeses and butters, and dried fruits and veggies.
Every classic is covered, including: gravlax, confit chicken, candied peel, quince cheese, elderflower cordial, mint jelly, onion marmalade, rhubarb chutney, sloe gin, raspberry jam and piccalilli. There are many others, some of them centuries old, some of them modern inventions, such as Banana and Date Chutney and Grapefruit and Elderflower Marmalade. Emma also includes expert tips on troubleshooting and information on all the equipment you will need. Pick up your muslins and straining funnel and get preserving!

About the Author
Emma Macdonald is the culinary brains behind The Bay Tree, founded from her mother's kitchen table 18 years ago and now the finest and most popular upmarket provider of pickles and relishes, jams, marinades and chutneys in the UK. She is author of The Artisan Market. The author lives in UK.
